m:MaterialTitle.title: Super Heroes
m:MaterialTitle.description: Search icon must activate a search component inside the navbar. See below the guidelines on how to implement it.

m:MaterialLabel.text: Batman's secret identity is Bruce Wayne, an American billionaire, playboy, philanthropist, and owner of Wayne Enterprises. After witnessing the murder of his parents as a child, he swore revenge on criminals, an oath tempered by a sense of justice. Wayne trains himself both physically and intellectually and crafts a bat-inspired persona to fight crime.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Markup
m:MaterialTitle.description: You must add visible='false' property into your navbar search component.

g:HTMLPanel.demo:PrettyPre:
<!-- Navbar component that contains a search icon -->
<m:MaterialNavBar ui:field="navBar" paddingLeft="20" width="100%" backgroundColor="blue darken-2" activates="sideBar" textColor="white">
<m:MaterialNavBrand ui:field="navBrand" text="GWT Material"/>
<m:MaterialLink ui:field="btnSearch" iconType="SEARCH" iconColor="white" float="RIGHT"/>
</m:MaterialNavBar>
<!-- NavBar Search -->
<m:MaterialNavBar ui:field="navBarSearch" width="100%" visible="false">
<m:MaterialSearch ui:field="txtSearch" placeholder="Component" backgroundColor="white" iconColor="black" active="true" grid="l3" shadow="1"/>
</m:MaterialNavBar>

m:MaterialTitle.title: Activator
m:MaterialTitle.description: To activate your search you must add a click handler into your activator e.g search icon.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Populating data
m:MaterialTitle.description: Take note that we are using Search Object by default to handle the search results. You can also create an object and extend it to Search Object so that you can add your custom attribute e.g Hero.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Add Close Handler
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can add a logic into your search component.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Add Finish Handler
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can add a finish handler into your search component but by default you can just add link value to your search object to set its href attribute.
